CONCLUSION: Violation of Article 5 - Right to liberty and security
JUDGES: David Thór Björgvinsson;Giovanni Bonello;Lech Garlicki;Ledi Bianku;Mihai Poalelungi;Nicolas Bratza
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in PERSON . He is currently serving a sentence of imprisonment in FAC .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant was arrested on suspicion of murder .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG ( Sąd Rejonowy ) remanded him in custody . It justified the applicant ’s pretrial detention by the gravity of the offence , the existence of strong evidence against him , the likelihood that a heavy penalty would be imposed and by the need to ensure the proper conduct of the proceedings .

CARDINAL . The applicant ’s appeal against the decision to remand him in custody was unsuccessful . On DATE ORG ( PERSON ) , relying on a reasonable suspicion that the applicant had committed a serious offence , upheld ORG decision .
CARDINAL . The applicant ’s pretrial detention was subsequently extended by decisions of ORG of , inter alia , DATE , DATE , DATE ( upheld by ORG on DATE ) , CARDINAL DATE and DATE .

CARDINAL . Once the length of the applicant ’s detention had reached the statutory twoyear maximum laid down in Article CARDINAL § CARDINAL of the Code of Criminal Procedure ( Kodeks postępowania karnego ) , the firstinstance court was no longer competent to extend it . Consequently , it was ORG ( Sąd Apelacyjny ) which issued further extensions on , inter alia , DATE , DATE , DATE and DATE .

CARDINAL . The courts repeatedly justified the applicant ’s pretrial detention in the initial phase by the existence of strong evidence against him , the likelihood that a heavy penalty would be imposed and the reasonable risk that the applicant would attempt either to induce witnesses to give false testimony or to obstruct the proper course of proceedings by other unlawful means . They further stressed that it would be necessary to hear evidence from a large number of witnesses and to obtain expert reports .

CARDINAL . In the latter stages of the applicant ’s detention , the courts additionally referred to the complexity of the case and the fact that there was strong evidence against him and other defendants .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG dismissed a cassation appeal lodged by the applicant .
